item.title: [SPR-2289] The <spring-form:form> tag does not bind to command objects set in a webflow FormAction
item.summary: The <spring-form:form> tag does not bind to command objects set in a webflow FormAction

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Grant,

I'm having a really hard time trying to reproduce this. I ported the SWF samples to use the new form tags and it seems to work just fine. Can you create a small WAR that shows just this failure and attach it to this issue with source. If can get your case running inside the debugger I should have much more luck.

Rob

I'll be looking at this code again in the next couple days and will try to abstract out an example..

Thanks!

Rob, Do you think this only happens when using Tiles?

For example, my <view-state> is as follows:

<view-state id="editDeliveryAddress" view="enterDeliveryAddressesOnCheckoutLanding">
<entry-actions>
<action bean="configureAddressFormAction" method="setupForm"/>
</entry-actions>
<transition on="submit" to="configureDeliveryInformation">
<action bean="configureAddressFormAction" method="bindAndValidate">
</action>
</transition>
</view-state>

My setup form is as follows in the "configureAddressFormAction"

@Override public Event setupForm( RequestContext requestContext ) throws Exception
{
super.setupForm(requestContext);
requestContext.getRequestScope().put("directions", Address.getStreetDirections());

String addressId = requestContext.getRequestParameters().get("addressId");

_logger.debug("#### " + "Found Address ID: " + addressId);

if (StringUtils.hasText(addressId))

{ // We are editing an existing address. int addrId = Integer.parseInt(addressId); Address address = getAddressManager().getAddress(addrId); _logger.debug("#### " + "putting address into scope: " + address); requestContext.getRequestScope().put("address", address); requestContext.getConversationScope().put("address", address); requestContext.getExternalContext().getRequestMap().put("address", address); }

return success();
}

Somehow I have a feeling this happen when using tiles? Anyway, I'm going to try to put a WAR together but it's hard to break apart this complex flow into a simple example....

Also, if I change the commandName to say "address2" I get:

"Neither Errors instance nor plain target object for bean name 'address2' available as request attribute'".

I also tried breaking up my setupForm method into 2 methods resulting in my view-state being defined as:

<view-state id="addNewDeliveryAddress" view="enterDeliveryAddressesOnCheckoutLanding">
<entry-actions>
<action bean="configureAddressFormAction" method="setupForm"/>
<action bean="configureAddressFormAction" method="setupFormDisplay"/>
</entry-actions>

<transition on="submit" to="isDeliveryWithinDeliveryArea">
<action bean="configureAddressFormAction" method="bindAndValidate">
</action>
</transition>
</view-state>

I am still seeing my address object in the request, printable by the code "$

{address}

" on the screen but still no binding on the form...

Ah Tiles! That may well be the problem. Can you try tonight's snapshot - I made some modifications to how data is passed between tags (using REQUEST scope rather than PAGE) so that you can use JSP 2.0 tag files - I assume the same fix will apply here.

No need to worry about the sample being too simple - as long as I can fire up the WAR in Tomcat and find out what the state of the tags is in the debugger - hopefully the snapshot will work.

Rob
Still no go with latest. I'm going to attach a ZIP with an IntelliJ project that has a simple sample web app. It's a highly ripped apart version of the app I am working on.
Here is the exploded WAR – I took out hibernate3 jar files, spring jars, and aspectj weaver files to fit it under 10 megs. I'm attaching IntelliJ project separately

Grant,

I think there is a misunderstanding here

It is not enough to expose the object in the request or page scope - the corresponding BindingResult has to be generated. The easiest way to do this in SWF is to use the standard setupForm method and override loadFormObject() with your custom logic.

Hope that helps.

Rob
Doh. OK. I will give that a shot today. Sorry to waste your time on this issue
Rob – feel free to close the issue. I did as you described and, magic! it's working

You didn't waste my time - its good to have these issues clarified. I'll get someone to put some documentation together so that this point is cleared up.

Rob
